intro: Lastrea spectabilis, commonly known as the showy lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
